document_info.title: CYP450 Enzyme Database for Oilahuasca
document_info.subtitle: Comprehensive Analysis of Cytochrome P450 Interactions with Herbs and Spices
document_info.purpose: Understanding enzyme modulation for strategic oilahuasca formulation

what_are_cyp450_enzymes.definition: Heme-containing monooxygenase proteins that insert oxygen into substrates
what_are_cyp450_enzymes.location: Primarily in liver (also intestine, kidney, lung), membrane-bound (endoplasmic reticulum)
what_are_cyp450_enzymes.function: Essential for xenobiotic metabolism (drugs, toxins, foreign compounds)
what_are_cyp450_enzymes.research_quote: Human cytochrome P450 (CYP) enzymes play important roles in the detoxification of drugs, cellular metabolism, and homeostasis. Almost 80% of oxidative metabolism and approximately 50% of the overall elimination of common clinical drugs can be attributed to CYP450.

CYP3A4.note: MOST IMPORTANT clinically, also in intestine

CYP1A2.note: PRIMARY for allylbenzenes, highly inducible by coffee/smoking

genetic_polymorphism.poor_metabolizers_pm: Deficient enzyme activity, drugs accumulate, higher risk of side effects
genetic_polymorphism.extensive_metabolizers_em: Normal enzyme activity, standard drug metabolism
genetic_polymorphism.ultra_rapid_metabolizers_um: Extra gene copies, very fast metabolism, may need higher doses
genetic_polymorphism.oilahuasca_implication: CYP1A2 polymorphism could affect myristicin metabolism - some individuals more sensitive, others may need higher doses

phase_i_functions: Makes compounds more reactive (paradoxically sometimes MORE toxic)

induction_vs_inhibition.oilahuasca_strategy: Coffee: Inducer (prepare system) + Nutmeg, cinnamon, pepper: Inhibitors (block metabolism) = Maximum effect

mechanism.step_1: Caffeine (or other coffee compounds) bind to AhR (Aryl hydrocarbon Receptor)
mechanism.step_3: AhR binds to XRE (Xenobiotic Response Elements) in CYP1A2 gene promoter

other_coffee_compounds.chlorogenic_acids: Polyphenols (antioxidants), may contribute to CYP1A2 induction
other_coffee_compounds.kahweol_cafestol: Diterpenes in unfiltered coffee (French press, espresso), may induce Phase II enzymes (GST)

mao_interaction.note: Main role is CYP1A2 induction; myristicin provides MAO inhibition

acute_protocol.purpose: Allows early phase induction to begin

mechanism_based_inhibition.research_quote: CYP cocktail assays showed that myristicin most significantly inhibits CYP1A2 among five CYP enzymes (CYP1A2, CYP2D6, CYP2E1, CYP3A4 and CYP2C19) from human liver microsomes. The 3.21-fold IC50 shift value of CYP1A2 indicates that myristicin may be a mechanism-based inhibitor of CYP1A2.
mechanism_based_inhibition.ic50_shift_meaning: Without pre-incubation IC50 = X; with 30-min pre-incubation IC50 = X/3.21. Inhibition becomes 3.21× stronger with time - diagnostic of mechanism-based inhibition.

mechanism_detailed.step_1_binding: Myristicin enters CYP1A2 active site, heme iron binds to substrate
mechanism_detailed.step_2_oxidation: Normal catalytic cycle begins (Fe³⁺ + O₂ → Compound I)
mechanism_detailed.step_4_inactivation: Reactive intermediate + enzyme active site amino acids → Covalent adduct → Enzyme PERMANENTLY modified → Cannot function → Must be degraded and replaced (24-72 hours)

glutathione_rescue_experiment.research_quote: Reduced glutathione was shown to block the inhibition of CYP1A2, indicating that myristicin utilized a mechanism-based inhibition.
glutathione_rescue_experiment.conclusion: GSH traps reactive intermediate before it can attack enzyme
glutathione_rescue_experiment.clinical_implication: When glutathione is depleted (by cinnamon), mechanism-based inhibition is ENHANCED (no rescue)

enzyme_induction_paradox.research_quote: Treatment of rats with myristicin caused 2-20 fold increases in liver P450 1A1/2, 2B1/2, and 2E1 enzyme activities relative to controls.
enzyme_induction_paradox.time_course: Single dose: Inhibition dominates (hours); Repeated dosing: Induction accumulates (days)
enzyme_induction_paradox.mechanism: Myristicin (or metabolites) activate AhR, CAR, PXR receptors → induce CYP450 genes

temporal_profile_single_dose.T_4_12hr: Mechanism-based inhibition accumulating, CYP1A2 activity declining
temporal_profile_single_dose.T_12_24hr: Minimum CYP1A2 activity, psychoactive effects emerging
temporal_profile_single_dose.T_24_48hr: Gene induction beginning, new enzyme synthesis

mao_inhibition.historical_research: Nutmeg and its active component, myristicin, show evidence of central monoamine oxidase (MAO) inhibition (1963)
evidence: Lowered convulsive dose of tryptamine (MAO substrate)
mao_inhibition.type: Probably both MAO-A and MAO-B, moderate potency
mao_inhibition.relevance: Contributes to psychoactive effects, may enhance endogenous monoamines

gst_induction.research_quote: A/J albino mice, given 5 to 50 mg doses of myristicin, showed 4- to 14-fold increase in liver GST specific activity
gst_induction.paradox: Myristicin induces GST (should INCREASE detox) BUT cinnamon depletes GSH (substrate for GST). No substrate → GST can't function even if induced.

dose_dependent_effects.culinary_0_5_1g: No psychoactive effects, minimal CYP450 effects, safe
dose_dependent_effects.low_1_2g: Mild psychoactive effects, some CYP1A2 inhibition, generally tolerable
dose_dependent_effects.medium_2_5g: Clear psychoactive effects, significant CYP1A2 inhibition, moderate side effects
dose_dependent_effects.high_5_10g: Strong psychoactive effects, near-complete CYP1A2 inhibition, severe side effects common
dose_dependent_effects.toxic_over_10g: Dangerous, medical attention may be required

multiple_cyp450_inhibition.research_citation: Effects of mace and nutmeg on human cytochrome P450 3A4 and 2C9 activity... Cinnamon significantly inhibited CYP3A4 or CYP2C9 activity.

time_dependent_inhibition.research: Mechanisms of Herb-Drug Interactions Involving Cinnamon and Cytochrome P450 2A6: Focus on Time-dependent Inhibition by Cinnamaldehyde
time_dependent_inhibition.finding: Pre-incubation increases inhibition, similar to mechanism-based inhibition

active_compounds.cinnamaldehyde: Main flavor compound (65-80% of bark oil), reactive aldehyde group
active_compounds.eugenol: Especially in cassia cinnamon, anesthetic properties
active_compounds.coumarin: In cassia (not Ceylon), hepatotoxic in high doses

glutathione_depletion_critical.research_quote: Induction of apoptosis by cinnamaldehyde through reactive oxygen species production, glutathione depletion, and caspase activation

mechanism.step_1_ros_production: Cinnamaldehyde disrupts mitochondrial function → Reactive Oxygen Species generated → Oxidative stress
mechanism.step_2_gsh_depletion: ROS accumulate + Glutathione (antioxidant) → GSH oxidized (used up) → GSH stores depleted
mechanism.step_3_consequences: Low GSH → Cannot neutralize ROS → Cannot conjugate Phase II metabolites → Metabolites accumulate → Prolonged drug effects
mechanism.step_4_high_doses: Severe oxidative stress → Caspase cascade → Apoptosis (cell death)

glutathione_depletion_critical.oilahuasca_relevance: At oilahuasca doses: Steps 1-2 occur (beneficial for potentiation). At very high doses: Step 4 occurs (toxicity).

triple_mechanism_for_oilahuasca.mechanism_1_cyp450_inhibition: Blocks CYP3A4 (backup pathway), CYP2C9, CYP2A6, 2D (prevents alternative routes)
triple_mechanism_for_oilahuasca.mechanism_2_gsh_depletion: GSH used up by ROS, Phase II detox compromised, cannot conjugate metabolites, prolongs effects
triple_mechanism_for_oilahuasca.mechanism_3_gst_substrate_depletion: Even if GST enzyme induced, no glutathione substrate available, GST cannot function
triple_mechanism_for_oilahuasca.combined_result: Phase I: Blocked (CYP450 inhibition) + Phase II: Blocked (GSH depletion) + Alternative Pathways: Blocked = MAXIMUM METABOLITE ACCUMULATION

cassia_vs_ceylon.recommendation: Ceylon preferred (lower toxicity); Cassia acceptable for single use

optimal_dosing.timing: 30-60 minutes before allylbenzenes (allows GSH depletion and CYP450 inhibition to establish)
optimal_dosing.amount: 1-2 teaspoons ground cinnamon (2-4g) OR cinnamon stick tea (steep 2 sticks) OR cinnamon extract
optimal_dosing.form: Ground bark most common; cinnamon oil very concentrated (use 5-10 drops)

safety_considerations.coumarin_toxicity: Tolerable daily intake: 0.1 mg/kg body weight. Single doses for oilahuasca: Probably safe.
safety_considerations.cinnamaldehyde: GI irritation at very high doses, generally safe at 2-4g
safety_considerations.drug_interactions: Will increase levels of ANY CYP3A4/2C9 substrate including many prescription medications

black_pepper_piperine_detailed.role: SELECTIVE CYP3A4 INHIBITOR - Blocks Backup Pathway

selective_inhibition.research_quote: Piperine is a relatively selective CYP3A4 inhibitor
selective_inhibition.value: Specifically blocks CYP3A4 (main backup pathway) without interfering with CYP1A2 (myristicin's target)

dual_mechanism.action_1_cyp3a4_inhibition: Competitive inhibition, piperine competes with substrates, reversible, dose-dependent
dual_mechanism.action_2_p_glycoprotein_inhibition: P-gp = efflux pump in intestinal cells, pumps drugs back into gut, piperine blocks this pump, increases oral bioavailability
dual_mechanism.combined_effect: Drug absorption ↑ (P-gp blocked) + Drug metabolism ↓ (CYP3A4 blocked) = MUCH higher bioavailability

piperine_content.calculation: 1g black pepper = 50-100mg piperine; Effective dose: 5-20mg; Required: 100-400mg black pepper

oilahuasca_role.the_backup_pathway_problem: CYP1A2 (blocked by myristicin) → Body tries CYP3A4 as backup → Piperine blocks CYP3A4 → No backup pathway available → Accumulation
oilahuasca_role.strategic_importance: Without piperine, when CYP1A2 is saturated, CYP3A4 takes over. Piperine ensures this doesn't happen.

other_compounds.chavicine: Geometric isomer of piperine, similar properties, also present (~1-3%)
other_compounds.methyleugenol: Trace amounts, adds to allylbenzene load (minimal)

optimal_use.long_pepper: Traditional Ayurvedic use, similar piperine content
optimal_use.timing: 30-60 minutes before allylbenzenes (allows enzyme binding) or concurrent with other inhibitors

synergy_with_cinnamon.research: Cinnamon, black pepper, ginger, mace, and nutmeg significantly inhibited CYP3A4 or CYP2C9 activity
synergy_with_cinnamon.combined: Cinnamon (CYP3A4 + CYP2C9 + others) + Pepper (CYP3A4 selective) = Stronger CYP3A4 inhibition, additive or synergistic

safety.culinary_doses: 500mg-1g pepper: Very safe, used worldwide in cooking
safety.high_doses: >5g pepper: GI irritation possible, burning sensation

parsley_apiole_detailed.role: CYP1A INHIBITOR + DMMDA SUBSTRATE - Dual Action Like Myristicin

mixed_type_inhibition.research_quote: Apiole, an important constituent of parsley, is a mixed-type inhibitor of the CYP1A subfamily

what_is_mixed_type.competitive_component: Apiole competes with substrates for active site, reversible, increases Km
what_is_mixed_type.non_competitive_component: Apiole binds elsewhere on enzyme, changes enzyme shape, decreases Vmax

mixed_type_inhibition.assays_used: EROD (CYP1A1 marker), MROD (CYP1A2 marker) - both inhibited by apiole

docking_studies.research: Docking assays explain how apiole interacts with the CYP1A subfamily
findings: Apiole fits well into CYP1A active site
Methoxy groups interact with enzyme protein

dual_role_like_myristicin.role_2_inhibitor: Apiole binds to CYP1A1/1A2 → Blocks enzyme active site → Prevents metabolism of self and others → Substrate accumulation
dual_role_like_myristicin.significance: Like myristicin, apiole BOTH is psychoactive AND blocks its own metabolism - SELF-POTENTIATING!

synergy_with_myristicin.combined_effect: More total substrate loading + Stronger enzyme inhibition + Different inhibition mechanisms = DRAMATICALLY ENHANCED EFFECT

parsley_leaf_vs_seed.fresh_parsley_leaves: Low essential oil (~0.05-0.1%), would need massive amounts, not practical
parsley_leaf_vs_seed.parsley_seeds: High essential oil (~2-7%), oil is 10-30% apiole, practical source
parsley_leaf_vs_seed.parsley_seed_essential_oil: Commercial product, concentrated, easier to dose, 10-20 drops = significant apiole

safety.abortifacient_warning: Apiole was used historically to induce abortion - dangerous, often ineffective, sometimes fatal
safety.modern_status: No longer used medically. ABSOLUTELY AVOID during pregnancy.
safety.otherwise: Relatively safe at oilahuasca doses, long-term toxicity unknown

preparation_phase.timing: 24-72 hours before (regular drinking) or 30-60 min before

inhibitor_loading_phase.result: Alternative pathways blocked, Phase II compromised

actions: Multiple allylbenzenes compete for remaining enzyme
substrate_loading_phase.result: Phase I minimal metabolism + Phase II blocked = METABOLITE ACCUMULATION

the_induction_inhibition_paradox_explain.question: Why would you both INDUCE (increase) and INHIBIT (block) the same enzyme?
the_induction_inhibition_paradox_explain.naive_logic: More enzyme + Blocked enzyme = Cancel out?
the_induction_inhibition_paradox_explain.actual_result: More enzyme + Blocked enzyme = MAXIMUM ACCUMULATION
the_induction_inhibition_paradox_explain.analogy: Like building more highway lanes right before blocking them all - the bigger the highway, the worse the traffic jam when blocked

phase_i_and_ii_double_blockade.phase_i_blocked: CYP450 enzymes inhibited (myristicin mechanism-based, apiole mixed-type, cinnamon/pepper competitive)
phase_i_and_ii_double_blockade.phase_ii_blocked: Cinnamon depletes glutathione (GSH), even if GST induced, no substrate available
phase_i_and_ii_double_blockade.result: Metabolites cannot be formed quickly AND cannot be excreted quickly = maximum accumulation and prolonged effects
